interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Scandal At Scourie (1953)
Review Date: 2018/10/12
Store: Greer Garson  (Actor),     Walter Pidgeon  (Actor),     Jean Negulesco  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles
Product Description: ["Legendary Hollywood screen pair Greer Garson and Walter Pidgeon team for the ninth and last time in Scandal at Scourie, a heart-tugging Technicolor drama that has the duo facing obstacles with the kind of unbreakable love that saw them through aerial bombardments in Mrs. Miniver or the challenges of the medical unknown in Madame Curie. Set in Ontario, Canada, the story centers on Victoria and Patrick McChesney, whose decision to adopt an orphaned Catholic girl ignites controversy in their Protestant community. Patrick is accused of using the adoption to appeal to Catholic voeters and advance his political career. Victoria contends with self-righteous whispers about the child's out-of-wedlock birth. And an event in the child's past leads to a fear-mongering change that she is a pyromaniac. Passions and accusations rage. But like a ship plying stormy seas, the McChesney' love for each other and their child will prevail."]
Average Rating: 4.8

Derailed (Unrated Widescreen)
Jennifer Aniston  (Actor),     Vincent Cassel  (Actor),     Mikael Hafstrom  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    Unrated    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
["Advertising executive Charles Schine is just another Chicago commuter who regularly catches the 8:43 A.M. train to work. But the one day he misses his train and meets Lucinda Harris, his life is changed forever. Lucinda is charming, beautiful and seductive. Despite the fact that each are married with children, their attraction to one another is magnetic. Lunch dates quickly become cocktails after work, and before long, Charles and Lucinda's infatuation leads them to a hotel room. Their seemingly perfect affair goes terribly awry when LaRoche, a brutal stranger, breaks into their room and holds them at gunpoint. This once illicit liaison turns into a nightmare more dangerous and violent than either could have ever imagined. Charles' life soon becomes filled with deception, blackmail, violence and crime. Unable to confide in his wife or speak to the police, Charles finds himself trapped in a world he doesn't recognize, with no trace of the life he once knew."]

Five Stars
The Professional
Jean Reno  (Actor),     Gary Oldman  (Actor),     Luc Besson  (Director, Producer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Sony Pictures Home Entertainment, All Sony Pictures Titles
['Jean Reno, Gary Oldman, Natalie Portman and Danny Aiello star in', 'Leon the Professional', ', a go-for-broke thriller about a professional assassin whose work becomes dangerously personal. Calling himself a "cleaner," the mysterious Léon is New York\'s top hit man. When his next-door neighbors are murdered, Léon becomes the unwilling guardian of the family\'s sole survivor - 12-year-old Mathilda. But Mathilda doesn\'t just want protection; she wants revenge. Training her in the deadly tricks of his trade, Léon helps her track the psychotic agent who murdered her family. From the electrifying opening to the fatal finale,', 'Leon the Professional', ', is a nonstop crescendo of action, suspense and surprises. Experience the uncut version, with 24 minutes of footage not included in the original U.S. theatrical version.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Movie Genre Preference:** The user continues to favor engaging narratives, expanding their interest to include classic dramas alongside their primary preference for thrillers. This reflects a broader appreciation for complex emotional dynamics and personal stakes across various film styles.
- **Format Preference:** Their loyalty to the DVD format persists, demonstrating a nostalgic connection to physical media and the practical advantages it offers for viewing at their convenience.
- **Positive Rating Tendencies:** The user maintains a trend of consistently awarding high ratings, as evidenced by their latest 5-star review, indicating a discerning taste and notable engagement with films that resonate deeply with them.
- **Content Engagement:** The user's interest is not limited to contemporary thrillers; they also show an enthusiasm for classic films that capture strong narratives and emotional depth, highlighting their appreciation for multifaceted storytelling in both modern and vintage cinema.
- **Actors and Directors:** Their continued enthusiasm for established actors and directors is evident, particularly those known for delivering powerful performances and engaging plots, reflecting a preference for familiar talent that enriches the viewing experience.
- **Ease of Purchase:** They value convenient online purchasing experiences, showcasing a desire for efficiency in acquiring DVDs that align with their refined taste in films.

Overall, the user appreciates skillfully crafted films with rich narratives, remains committed to the DVD format, and seeks quality selections, embracing both thrillers and classic dramas.
